author: terencechain
content: Since we mentioned IL at the epbs breakout, I thought I'd capture it here. In slot auctions, because of the timing game, it may make sense to move the `start` (builder reveal) and `end` (PTC votes) earlier. Moving the `end` earlier makes sense, but what about the `start`? For solo validators, it doesn't matter, and on my local nodes, I can see 50% of attestation votes within an 800ms average, though it uses a lot of bandwidth and is probably not ideal for builders. The question is how early we can push the `start`. Pushing the `start` earlier allows us to push the `end` even earlier, which gives more time to the `IL committee` and `builder` of the subsequent slot. This helps FOCIL, I think.

author: soispoke
content: do you mean the time allocated to counting attestations (currently 3s) could be reduced? (move the start earlier)

author: terencechain
content: Oh no. Start here means when builder reveals. End here means when PTC votes on timeliness and block hash. I argue builder could reveal earlier than 6s if it has seen sufficient attestation votes

author: soispoke
content: right so cutting down on the time to count attestations for the builder? if the builder reveals earlier, it means it has seen enough attestations before 6 sec right? so time is reduced from 3s (between 3"s and 6s" in slot N) to less than 3s

author: terencechain
content: You are right. The start matters less here than the end. The question is how early we can push up the end time without hurting the builder.

author: soispoke
content: yes I like the idea of trying to get a bit more time there if possible
